translation.en: All right, it's the last day of school. We got five minutes to go over
all of American history.
Wiped out the indigenous people, oppressed the blacks,
did some good stuff around World War II, and now the sun is setting on our empire.
translation.ko: 2차 세계대전 때 좋은 일 좀 하는가 싶더니 지금 우리 제국은 끝물이죠

translation.en: [sighs] Yeah, I guess we did cover it all.
translation.ko: 그래, 빠뜨린 건 없는 것 같네

translation.en: Yeah, and even some stuff that didn't happen.
Like... landing on the moon. [scoffs] Come on! [laughs]
translation.ko: 달 착륙 같은 거 말이 돼?

translation.en: I really gotta get you off Reddit, Lorenzo.
All right, I see everybody gazing, looking out the window,
ready to go full Braveheart on everyone.
[shouts in Scottish accent] "They might take our lives, but they'll never take our freedom!"
[shouts in normal voice] Sorry, Ms. Thompson!
I didn't mean to scare you! [chuckles]
Oh, that's not gonna end well.
Of course, England did take Scotland's freedom,
and they've had it for over 700 years.
Don't tell Mel Gibson.
Wait, Mel Gibson lost?
Yeah, it was kind of the beginning of a long losing streak for him.
All right, bonus points.
What did America have that Scotland didn't have,
besides men who wear pants?
This is coming from a guy wearing shorts.
I got this. Weapons.
Seriously, Walt? You-- You think the Scots got to the battlefield and were like,
translation.ko: 월트, 스코틀랜드인들이 전쟁터에서 이랬을 것 같아?

translation.en: [in Scottish accent] "Hey, Angus, is there something we're forgetting?"
"Oh, no, I got my charger and my Bluetooth speakers."
"What're we forgetting?"
"Weapons!"
America was basically a castle with a 3,000-mile moat.
translation.ko: 미국은 5천 km에 달하는 해자로 둘러싸인 성과 같았죠

translation.en: It's called the Atlantic Ocean.
[in normal voice] Ding, ding, ding, ding, ding! Marisol is right once again!
Oh! You're always right. You're worse than my ex.
translation.ko: 넌 항상 옳아 내 전여친보다 더하다니까

translation.en: -[students laugh] -[teacher] All right, look, you guys.
It took the British two months to sail food
all the way across to here, all right?
translation.ko: 두 달이나 항해하고서야 여기 닿을 수 있었어

translation.en: They could've just called Domino's.
Ooh! I'll split a Meatlovers.
[chuckles] My man.
Okay, lightning round.
Who remembers the Monroe Doctrine?
Anyone else?
Go ahead.
In 1823, James Monroe declared any intervention by external powers
translation.ko: 1823년에 제임스 먼로가 아메리카 대륙에 대한 외부 세력의 참견을 모두 적대 행위로 선언했어요

translation.en: in the politics of the Americas a hostile act.
translation.ko: 외부 세력의 참견을 모두 적대 행위로 선언했어요

translation.en: So smart.
Yeah, Mikey, real smart.
Okay, now, while Monroe is best remembered for his doctrine,
translation.ko: 제임스 먼로는 먼로주의로 제일 유명하긴 하지만

translation.en: I think he really should be remembered
as the first president with enough courage to say,
translation.ko: 이런 말을 한 첫 번째 대통령이었다는 거야

translation.en: "Enough with the powdered wigs."
I mean, seriously. Aside from RuPaul, who thought this was a good look?
translation.ko: 솔직히 루폴 빼곤 누가 이걸 좋아하겠어?

translation.en: Our country was founded by a bunch of dudes
who woke up every morning asking their wives,
[in exaggerated British accent] "M'lady, have you seen my wig?
I-- I can't seem to find-- And my powder, I cannot find my powder!
translation.ko: '난 도저히 내 하얀 가발을 찾을 수가 없구려'

translation.en: Where is my powder?"
[in normal voice] Anyway, we went 200 years
without such a bizarre hairstyle again.
Until now.
We went from powdered wigs to one wig dipped in Cheeto dust.
translation.ko: 하얀 가발에서 시작해 치토스 가루 가발까지 온 거야

translation.en: At ease, y'all.
Oh, hey.
Mr. Iglesias is the cool teacher.
Why can't I be the cool principal, hmm?
-That's not a real question! -Oh!
Hold on! Hold on!
Before you run off and ghost ride your whips,
translation.ko: 여기서 뛰쳐 나가 묘기 운전 하고

translation.en: play dominoes on your stoop, drink your sizzurp...
translation.ko: 현관에 앉아 점도미노 하고 감기약 칵테일에 취하기 전에

translation.en: What is this old beat talking about?
I want you to tell me something you learned this year.
translation.ko: 올해 뭔가 배운 게 있다면 말해보겠니?

translation.en: Grace, you wanna make me look good in front of Principal Madison?
translation.ko: 그레이스, 매디슨 교장 선생님께 내 체면 좀 세워줄래?

translation.en: Grace talks in front of people now? I thought she had social anxiety.
translation.ko: 쟤가 남들 앞에서 말을 해요? 사회불안장애인 줄 알았는데

translation.en: Uh, she does, but she learned how to talk using the computer.
She's still a little shy, though.
[computer] I learned that Principal Madison sometimes cries
translation.ko: 교장 선생님이 주차장에 세워두신 포드 피에스타 안에서

translation.en: in the parking lot in her Ford Fiesta.
Not shy enough. [chuckles]
And for the record, it is a Hyundai Elantra.
translation.ko: 그리고 내 차 이름은 현대 엘란트라야

translation.en: And for the record, Grace's Wi-Fi just went bye-bye.
Gabe, I will see you in my office at 11:15.
And some of you, I will see next year.
translation.ko: 그리고 너희 중 몇 명은 내년에 보자

translation.en: -Hey, wait, what do you mean, "some"? -We just became sophomores!
Yup! Yup! PE requirements, done!
Everybody have a good summer! Stay outta trouble!
translation.ko: 모두 여름방학 잘 보내라 문제 일으키지 말고

translation.en: Don't get caught!
Can I talk to you, Mr. Iglesias?
Being that I'm the only person you speak to out loud, I have to say yes.
translation.ko: 네가 직접 말하는 사람은 나뿐인데 거절할 수 있겠냐?

translation.en: I-- I wanted to warn you,
Paula's probably a little cranky. [chuckles nervously]
translation.ko: 교장 선생님 심기가 좀 불편하실 거예요

translation.en: She hasn't been getting a lot of pokes on her dating app,
translation.ko: 데이트 앱에서 '콕 찔러보기'를 별로 못 받았거든요

translation.en: if you know what I mean.
I know what you mean, but do you know what you mean?
translation.ko: 난 무슨 말인지 아는데 넌 무슨 말인지 아니?

translation.en: Grace, we talked about your hacking problem.
How about you? Are you on any dating sites?
translation.ko: 선생님은 데이트 사이트 이용 안 하세요?

translation.en: I, uh-- Just one.
It's called, uh, "taking time to reflect on my personal mistakes...
dot com."
Have a good summer!
Oh, this is sick!
-1962 VW Bus. Hippie not included. -Ah!
You can put it on your dashboard for your summer trip.
translation.ko: 휴가 가실 때 차 대시보드에 올려놓으세요

translation.en: Oh, thank you. Dashboard? What do you mean, dashboard?
No, I'm putting this in a safety-deposit box.
You know, this is officially the nicest thing I own.
God, I hope you're kidding.
But you deserve it. Thanks for a great year, Mr. Iglesias.
This is cool! [chuckles]
"Hey, come on, man, let's go!" [imitates engine revving]
"I'm hungry." "Well, let's go to Chipotle!"
"Hey, you know that's not real Mexican food."
"I don't care, I'm high." [imitates brakes squealing]
-Tony! -Hey, bro.
Dude, were you just stealing out of the basket?
translation.ko: 방금 이 바구니에서 돈 훔치려고 했어?

translation.en: No.
Come on, man. This is the GoFundMe for Mr. Hayward's new hip.
translation.ko: 헤이워드 선생님 고관절 수술비 모금함에 손대면 쓰냐?

translation.en: I had another bad year at the track.
Oh, big surprise. You know who doesn't have a bad year at the track?
translation.ko: 당연한 거 아냐? 경마장에서 한몫 잡는 게 누구게?

translation.en: The track.
Well, you know what they say about gambling.
"Just keep trying."
Eh, sounds like your dating life.
Yeah, well, anyway,
my losing streak... means I gotta teach summer school.
translation.ko: 계속 잃다 보니 여름 학기 수업 하게 생겼어

translation.en: [sighs] That freakin' sucks, man. I wish you could go with me on this road trip.
translation.ko: 짜증 나네 같이 자동차 여행 갈까 했는데

translation.en: Yeah, man, it'd be like Thelma & Luis.
Ah, there she is. Rookie of the year.
Oh, I don't know about that. [chuckles]
Come on, Abby, you're the only new teacher this year.
If you don't win, that's just sad.
But I can be the strong-but-tender shoulder for you to cry on.
translation.ko: 못 받아도 걱정 마요 넓고 푹신한 어깨를 빌려줄 테니

translation.en: Ooh! Now I really wanna win.
So, are you excited for your road trip, Gabe?
translation.ko: 게이브는 자동차 여행 갈 생각에 신나겠네요?

translation.en: Yeah. [chuckles]
My bus is all gassed up,
got my '90s Spotify playlist ready with a lot of R&B.
translation.ko: 플레이리스트에 90년대 노래 특히 R&B로 꽉꽉 채워뒀어요

translation.en: You guys are adorable.
You know who's gonna love you? My fiancé.
translation.ko: 취향 딱 맞을 사람 있어요 제 약혼자요

translation.en: Ah, "fiancé," man. Yeah, that's French for "don't put your fry in her ketchup."
translation.ko: 약혼자래 불어로 저 여자 케첩에 네 감튀 찍지 말라는 뜻이야

translation.en: -Abby? Nobody's told you? -Hmm? What?
No relationship survives moving to California.
No. You gotta find that special someone...
translation.ko: 못 들었군요 '연인은 여기서 새로 만나야 한다'

translation.en: -here. -[Abby] Oh.
I hate to agree with him on this one, but yeah.
You know those things you found charming back in South Dakota?
[inhales sharply] Ah, they just won't measure up here -in the big leagues. -Uh-uh.
Oh! So, you two are the big leagues?
Yup.
-Us and Ryan Gosling. -[Abby laughs]
Hey, Mr. Hayward!
Gabriel. When are you going to start calling me Ray?
translation.ko: 가브리엘, 언제쯤이면 날 레이라고 불러줄 거지?

translation.en: What would've happened if we called you Ray
translation.ko: 저희가 학생 때 그랬으면 어떻게 됐을까요?

translation.en: -when you were our teacher? -I would've whipped your asses.
translation.ko: 저희가 학생 때 그랬으면 어떻게 됐을까요? 엉덩이 팡팡 맞았겠지

translation.en: Hey! Hey, who's been dipping in my hip money?
translation.ko: 누가 내 엉덩이 모금함에 빨대 꽂았어?

translation.en: You know, my grandmother had a hip replacement.
Yeah? How's she doing?
Oh, she only used it for a month, so... we got most of our money back.
translation.ko: 한 달밖에 못 쓰셔서 거의 다 환급받았어요

translation.en: Hey, you got another year left in you, Mr. Hayward?
The only way I can get out of here without a goddamn party in my honor
translation.ko: 내가 퇴임식도 못 치르고 이 학교를 떠날 유일한 순간은

translation.en: is on a gurney with a sheet over my head.
translation.ko: 시트에 덮여 들것에 실려 나갈 때뿐이야

translation.en: -Great, have a nice summer! -[Ray] Yeah, yeah.
Don't look at me, boo.
I gotta get a date.
-Do you have any brothers? -Two. But they're married.
translation.ko: - 형제 있어요? - 둘 있는데 다 결혼했어요

translation.en: Not to each other, that would be weird.
translation.ko: 둘이 했다는 건 아니에요 그럼 이상하죠

translation.en: Well, marriage is not necessarily a deal-breaker.
Sneaking around can be an aphrodisiac.
So is honest communication with your partner.
Ah, the history department.
Ms. Spencer, an outstanding teacher.
Gabe and Tony, also teachers.
Now, if you'll excuse me, I have some letters to deliver.
You'd fit right in as a mailman.
Dogs already don't like you.
Captain Tennille, my Bichon Frise, would beg to differ.
translation.ko: 우리 비숑 프리제 캡틴 테닐 생각은 다를걸요

translation.en: [gasps] Did you rescue him?
No, he rescued me.
So, Helen Stone is taking early retirement this year,
translation.ko: 헬렌 스톤 선생님이 올해 조기 퇴직하신다니까

translation.en: and one of you will be getting her honor students section this fall.
translation.ko: 올가을부터 세 분 중 한 분이 우등반을 맡으셔야겠어요

translation.en: [gasps] I'll do it. I can have a syllabus ready by the end of lunch.
translation.ko: 저 할게요, 점심시간 끝나고 수업 계획표 제출할 수 있어요

translation.en: And Gabe drives a silly-bus.
Well, I guess that eliminates Tony.
Not yet.
All three of you take your lunch hour and come up with a mission statement
translation.ko: 세 분 모두 점심시간 동안 자신이 맡아야만 할 이유를 적은 제안서를 작성해 주세요

translation.en: as to why I should pick you,
translation.ko: 자신이 맡아야만 할 이유를 적은 제안서를 작성해 주세요

translation.en: and I'll make my decision at the end of the day.
You know what I like doing on my lunch hour? Lunch.
translation.ko: 저는 점심시간에 뭐 하고 싶게요? 점심식사요

translation.en: We all know you're gonna go with Abby to teach the honor students.
translation.ko: 애비가 우등반을 맡게 될 거 이미 다 아는걸요

translation.en: Well, I like to think that all of our students are honors students.
translation.ko: 저는 우리 학교 모든 학생이 우등생이라고 믿고 싶어요

translation.en: And I'd like to think Idris Elba is at home, waiting for me.
translation.ko: 난 이드리스 엘바가 우리 집에서 날 기다린다고 믿고 싶네요

translation.en: Come on, Tony, surprise me.
Don't suck so much.
You know, when a coach picks on you, that means you're the star player.
translation.ko: 감독이 자꾸 쪼는 선수가 진정한 스타 선수지

translation.en: Hmm. Sometimes, it just means you're bad.
[Gabe] Come on, Paula.
We both know you should go with me. No one teaches history like I do.
translation.ko: 당연히 날 뽑아야죠 역사는 내가 제일 잘 가르치니까

translation.en: I know. You're good.
That's why I let you slide with the dress code.
translation.ko: 그래서 그런 옷 입는 것도 봐주는 거예요

translation.en: What?
You can't hide these calves from the rest of the world.
translation.ko: 이런 장딴지는 온 세상에 보여줘야 한다고요

translation.en: Oh, that hurt.
You got your assignment, Gabe. I'll see you after lunch.
I can't get my leg off.
You okay?
You need some alone time in your Elantra?
My kid is graduating from middle school next week,
translation.ko: 우리 애가 다음 주에 중학교 졸업하는데

translation.en: and my ex-husband, the first one, is going to be there.
translation.ko: 내 전남편... 첫 번째 전남편이 오겠대요

translation.en: You meet the love of your life at Freaknik, and you think it's gonna last.
translation.ko: 프리크닉 파티에서 만난 사랑이 영원할 거라 생각했어요?

translation.en: Gabe, he's bringing his young wife.
I've been looking for a guy all year, but apparently,
I'm giving Southern California carpal tunnel from swiping left.
translation.ko: 남부 캘리포니아 남자들한테 왼쪽으로 스와이핑만 당했다고요

translation.en: You still got it.
You're smart, you're pretty, you're strong.
You're an amazing administrator.
Is this all a part of your mission statement?
If it's working, then yes.
[Walt] Mr. Iglesias!
-[Gabe] Oh, hey, Walt. -Great news.
I'm graduating early. [chuckles] Graduating? What're you talking about?
translation.ko: - 저 조기 졸업해요 - 졸업? 무슨 소리야?

translation.en: Check it out, I got a letter from Mr. Hernandez.
"Counseled... out."
Walt, you're not graduating, you're-- you're being expelled.
Well, I think we can agree,
the important thing is, I don't have to come back!
translation.ko: 중요한 건 학교 안 와도 된다는 거예요!

translation.en: School didn't want me, and I've never wanted it.
This is a no-fault divorce. Just like my folks.
So, what next? Goldman Sachs?
translation.ko: 그래서 뭐 할 건데? 골드만삭스 가시게?

translation.en: Foot Locker. I'll make those stripes look good.
Yeah, I doubt that. I used to work there. Heh. I looked like a fat barcode.
translation.ko: 글쎄다 나도 풋로커에서 일해봤는데 내가 뚱뚱한 바코드 같더라

translation.en: I think you can do better than Foot Locker.
translation.ko: 넌 풋로커보다 나은 데서 일할 수 있어

translation.en: You know what I'd really like to sell?
translation.ko: 제가 진짜 팔고 싶은 게 뭔지 아세요?

translation.en: Did the state of California legalize it in 2016?
I was gonna say custom rims, but I like your idea way better.
translation.ko: 저는 커스텀 림 얘기였는데 그게 훨씬 낫겠네요

translation.en: Thanks, Mr. Iglesias!
Uh, wait, no-- Uh-- You know, I was thinking shoe--
-People need shoes! -[Walt] Not as much as they need weed!
Yeah, but they need the shoes to get to the weed!
Hey, Tony. Any of your students get this weird letter?
translation.ko: 토니, 너희 반에 이런 편지 받은 학생 있어?

translation.en: Maybe. We're not that close.
Hey, can you help me with my mission statement?
Sure. I can't believe I'm still doing your homework.
translation.ko: 그래, 아직도 네 숙제를 도와주다니 안 믿기지만

translation.en: Just get me started.
All right. Uh... Why do you wanna teach the honors program?
translation.ko: 알았어 우등반을 가르치고 싶은 이유가 뭐야?

translation.en: Because it'd be way easier.
Lead with that.
You know, Tony, have you ever had a student who was afraid to try?
translation.ko: 토니, 시도 자체를 겁내는 학생을 본 적 있어?

translation.en: Yeah, that's half my kids.
Yeah.
And they worry that if they try their hardest then fail,
they can't ever use the excuse that they weren't really trying?
translation.ko: 열심히 안 했다는 핑계를 다신 못 댈까 봐 겁내잖아?

translation.en: Yeah, I see it all the time.
Well, this isn't about my students, this is about...
translation.ko: 근데 중요한 건 학생이 아니라 내...

translation.en: Oh! I see what you did there.
Gabe? I know we're competing against each other,
-but would you proof my mission statement? -You too?
Charts? You got charts?
And a bibliography?
Yeah. Is it tacky that I cited my own grad school thesis?
translation.ko: 네, 제 대학원 논문을 언급하는 건 너무 치사할까요?

translation.en: [both] Yes!
-Wait. Is this PowerPoint? -Mm-hmm.
You really do speak the language of the honors kids.
Oh, thank you! I also speak French.
-What did that mean? -I don't know,
but I've never been called "petite."
Hey, Mikey.
[sighs] You got a letter, too?
Ah, it's probably just a bill.
At my house, we don't open those till the one after final-final notice.
translation.ko: 저희 집에선 진짜 최종 경고장이 날아와야 읽거든요

translation.en: Yeah, I get it. You know, growing up, we were on a first-name basis with our repo man.
translation.ko: 이해해, 난 어릴 때 압류 직원이랑 엄청 친했어

translation.en: Yeah, Hector the collector even came to my graduation.
translation.ko: 헥터라는 직원은 내 졸업식에도 올 정도였지

translation.en: -[scoffs] Are you gonna pay that for me? -No, but someone is gonna pay for this.
translation.ko: - 대신 치러주시게요? - 아니, 하지만 누군가는 치러야지

translation.en: Yo, yo, wait up, wait up! I got more bills!
-[scoffs] We're in a meeting! -Yeah, and I'm in it too. Hi.
translation.ko: - 회의 중이잖아요 - 네, 나도 같이 해요 안녕하세요

translation.en: What do you want, Gabe?
What's up with these letters? And what the hell is "counseled out"?
It's a nice way of saying to our underperforming students,
translation.ko: 성적 부진 학생들에게 좋은 말로 이 뜻을 전하는 거죠

translation.en: "Dear dumb ass, get lost. Kmart is hiring." [laughs]
[Gabe] "Attention Kmart shoppers, pay no attention to the idiot on aisle five."
translation.ko: '케이 마트 손님 여러분, 5번 통로의 머저리는 신경 끄세요'

translation.en: [Paula] Gabe, we are a public school.
Our funding depends on meeting certain standards:
translation.ko: 운영 기금을 마련하려면 일정 수준에 도달해야 한다고요

translation.en: grades, discipline, attendance levels.
And the easiest way to improve those averages
translation.ko: 그리고 수준을 높이는 가장 쉬운 방법은

translation.en: is to counsel out the kids who are hurting the numbers.
translation.ko: 평균 까먹는 애들한테 자퇴를 권고하는 거죠

translation.en: What do you call this program?
"Some Children Left Behind"?
I don't hate it.
This program could make our school the educational pearl of the district.
translation.ko: 이 프로그램이면 지역 명문고로 거듭날 수 있어요

translation.en: Yeah.
All you gotta do is swipe left on a bunch of kids.
translation.ko: 이 애들을 왼쪽으로 스와이핑만 하면 되겠네요

translation.en: What's "swipe left"?
The story of my damn life.
-[exhales] Ah, Mr. Hayward! -Hey!
Have you heard about these "counseled out" letters?
The "not our problem anymore" letters.
Yeah, sure.
Always easier to juke the stats than reach the hard cases.
translation.ko: 학업 부진아들을 돕느니 통계 조작이 더 쉬운 법이거든

translation.en: Something tells me I need to sit down for this.
Gabriel, when I was about your age, I got a job offer at a private school.
translation.ko: 내가 자네 나이 때 사립학교에서 스카우트 제의를 받았어

translation.en: You know, where the students wear cardigans with the crests on them.
translation.ko: 알지? 가슴에 교표 달린 카디건 입은 학생들이 다니는 곳

translation.en: Hogwarts.
Yeah.
Then, at lunch, a couple of kids got in a little scrap.
translation.ko: 어느 날 점심시간에 학생 둘이 싸우는 거야

translation.en: As I was stopping the fight, one of the kids hit me,
and that's when I knew I needed to be here.
translation.ko: 그때 깨달았지 여기가 내 자리라는 걸

translation.en: Hit you so hard it gave you dementia.
[Ray] No.
See, I knew what that kid was dealing with at home,
translation.ko: 난 그 애 집안 분위기가 어떤지 알았어

translation.en: and I knew what would've happened if that kid had hit any other teacher.
translation.ko: 다른 선생을 쳤다면 걔가 어떻게 됐을지도 알았고

translation.en: If you had left, you wouldn't have been here when I was on the ropes.
translation.ko: 그때 떠나셨다면 제가 힘들 때 여기 안 계셨겠네요

translation.en: You were one of the kids that let me know I was doing the right thing.
translation.ko: 넌 내가 올바른 길을 택한 걸 일깨워준 학생 중에 하나야

translation.en: I wonder where I would've wound up without you, Mr. Hayward.
translation.ko: 선생님이 안 계셨으면 제가 어떻게 됐을지 모르겠어요

translation.en: Well, you'd have been in some low-paying job with lots of stress,
translation.ko: 쥐꼬리만 한 월급 주는 곳에서 스트레스 잔뜩 받고 있었겠지

translation.en: long hours...
Hey, there she is. Always reading something.
translation.ko: 여기 있었네 늘 뭔가 읽고 있다니까

translation.en: Yeah, my obituary.
[sighs] No way. Oh, they've gone too far now.
translation.ko: 말도 안 돼 이건 심해도 너무 심하잖아

translation.en: You're not just my best student, you're my favorite student.
translation.ko: 넌 내 최고의 학생이자 최애 학생인데

translation.en: We know you say that to all of us.
Yeah, I know, but when I'm talking to you, I'm not lying.
translation.ko: 맞아, 하지만 너한테 말할 때는 거짓말 아닌걸

translation.en: Letter says it's 'cause of attendance. I kinda missed some afternoon classes.
translation.ko: 출석일수 때문이래요 오후 수업을 몇 번 빼먹었거든요

translation.en: -Like how many? -Like all of them.
I work to help my family, but I did the assignments.
translation.ko: 일해야 집에 보탬이 돼서요 그래도 숙제는 했어요

translation.en: [sighs] I'm gonna take this to somebody who can help fix it.
Oh, my God, are you gonna have Hernandez jumped?
No, but I like your idea much better.
translation.ko: 그건 아니었는데 네 방법이 더 낫네

translation.en: Mm... I can't find any central database for the kids who got the letter.
translation.ko: 편지를 받은 아이들의 중앙 데이터베이스를 못 찾겠어요

translation.en: If I can't access the list, I can't change it.
translation.ko: 목록에 접근 못 하면 바꿀 수가 없어요

translation.en: And believe me, I need to.
Wait, you too? Well, why did you get a letter?
translation.ko: 잠깐, 너도? 네가 왜 그런 편지를 받아?

translation.en: For doing stuff like this.
That's right. That's... [chuckles] That's why I called you here.
I need your help getting Principal Madison in a good mood.
translation.ko: 교장 선생님 기분을 띄울 방법이 없을까?

translation.en: Just get a pitcher of appletinis in her.
I don't even wanna know how you know that.
translation.ko: 그걸 네가 어떻게 아는지 묻기도 겁난다

translation.en: It's on her profile.
"Just get a pitcher of appletinis in me, and let the magic happen."
translation.ko: '애플티니를 피처로 들이부으면 내 안에서 마법이 시작된답니다'

translation.en: You know, Grace,
I want you to know how proud I am of you and how far you've come this year,
translation.ko: 넌 올해 일취월장했어 대견하다고 말해주고 싶구나

translation.en: in case I get fired.
Fired? Why would you get fired?
You're the best teacher in the school.
[chuckles] Which, let's face it, that's a low bar.
You think maybe you can, uh, hack back into Principal Madison's dating profile?
translation.ko: 혹시 교장 선생님의 데이트 앱 프로필을 다시 해킹할 수 있니?

translation.en: Hmm... Which one do you want?
Uh, Bumble, Tinder, UrbanSwipe.
[chuckles] She's on everything but FarmersOnly.
translation.ko: 농부 전용 앱 빼곤 다 가입하셨어요

translation.en: Oh, wait, she's on that one too.
-Yeah, girl is rocking that cowboy hat! -Huh.
I'm going with...
Gabe!
Mother-flowers!
I mean, uh...
Congratulations, Gabe.
I just, you know...
Hey, Abby, that is why you should never try your hardest.
translation.ko: 애비, 이래서 최선을 다하면 안 되는 거예요

translation.en: Ooh. Yay, me. [chuckles]
What's the matter, Gabe?
You won! I figured right now you'd be doing your touchdown dance.
translation.ko: 이겼잖아요? 터치다운 댄스라도 춰야 하는 거 아니에요?

translation.en: You know...
♪ A little salsa, a little salsa ♪
You know, like a dab or two?
Come on.
Do your thing.
You know, I've been thinking...
instead of giving me the teach-approved kids,
I don't know, why don't you give me the kids
that got the "counseled out" letter from Hernandez?
You know, the world's worst pen pal?
[chuckles] Okay...
Carlos, can you come in here a sec?
[in dramatic tone] Locust, boils, darkness... Hernandez!
[in normal voice] Hey! We're just talking about you.
Carlos, Gabe has volunteered to teach the kids we've counseled out.
-Marisol Fuentes is my best student. -Her attendance is unacceptable.
translation.ko: 마리솔 푸엔테스는 내 최고의 학생이에요 출석 점수가 엉망이에요

translation.en: She works. She has a real job. You should try it!
translation.ko: 일하니까요, 진짜 일이에요 당신도 한번 해봐요

translation.en: We're just putting every student in a position to succeed.
translation.ko: 우린 모든 학생에게 성공할 기회를 주려는 거예요

translation.en: Look, so many people have turned their backs on these kids,
translation.ko: 이 아이들에게 등 돌린 사람이 많은데

translation.en: and I don't want to be one of those people.
[chuckles] We're not turning our backs on them.
It's turning our faces to the good students.
Look, Hernandez may think that these kids are invisible,
translation.ko: 허낸데즈는 걔들이 투명 인간으로 보이나 본데

translation.en: but I see them. All of them.
translation.ko: 난 그 애들이 보여요 전부 다

translation.en: [Carlos] It's done.
Hold on, Carlos.
Yeah, hold on, Carlos.
"Invisible," you say, Gabe?
Did I?
You know...
a woman gets to a certain age, and she sure knows what that feels like.
translation.ko: 여자가 어느 연령대가 되면 투명 인간이 된 기분을 절감해요

translation.en: People of color know what that feels like.
-Preach, sister. -Shut up, Carlos.
You know, it's the damnedest thing.
I got a message on my dating app a little while ago
translation.ko: 좀 전에 데이트 앱으로 메시지를 받았거든요?

translation.en: from this fine-looking, young Denzel-type
translation.ko: 젊은 시절 덴젤 워싱턴을 닮은 훈남이

translation.en: who wants to buy me an appletini.
Denzel? Is that even your type?
[chuckles] I'm alive, aren't I? Mm...
He even quoted Invisible Man. That's my favorite novel.
translation.ko: '투명 인간' 구절도 인용했더군요 내가 좋아하는 소설인데

translation.en: You know, I've been meaning to read it.
"I am invisible simply because people refuse to see me."
translation.ko: '내가 투명 인간인 건' '사람들이 날 보지 않으려 하기 때문이다'

translation.en: Wow, sounds like a real catch.
And then, you come in here, and you refer to these kids as invisible.
translation.ko: 근데 지금 게이브가 이 아이들을 투명 인간이라고 하다니

translation.en: That's quite a coincidence.
Or maybe it's a sign.
You know, if we don't see these kids now, no one ever will.
translation.ko: 지금 우리가 봐주지 않으면 아무도 봐주지 않을 거예요

translation.en: [sighs] All right, Gabriel.
You got this summer to turn 'em around.
Grades, discipline, attendance. No screw-ups.
translation.ko: 성적, 품행, 출석 셋 다 놓치면 안 돼요

translation.en: So, Gabe has to waste his summer teaching the drip tray,
translation.ko: 게이브가 여름방학 허비하며 꼴통들 가르치고 나면

translation.en: and then I get to kick them out. I can live with that.
translation.ko: 내가 쫓아내면 되는군요 그 정도는 감수할게요

translation.en: Well, you live with yourself.
You can live with anything.
We can't save them all, Gabe.
I know, but who are we if we don't even try?
translation.ko: 하지만 시도도 안 하면 우리가 무슨 선생이에요?

translation.en: He is fine!
Wait a second, this is Denzel.
This is a picture from The Pelican Brief.
Somebody photoshopped a cowboy hat on his damn head. Gabe!
Okay.
Some of you are here because of your poor grades, poor attendance,
translation.ko: 여기 모인 너희들은 점수가 낮거나 출석률이 낮거나

translation.en: disciplinary reasons, or all of the above.
translation.ko: 품행이 안 좋거나 혹은 셋 다다

translation.en: Messed around and got a triple-double.
Yup. [sighs] I gotta say, it was a good day. [chuckles]
All right, so I got some good news, and I have some bad news.
translation.ko: 좋아, 좋은 소식과 나쁜 소식이 둘 다 있다

translation.en: The good news is no one is getting counseled out.
translation.ko: 좋은 소식은 아무도 자퇴 권고 처분되지 않는다는 거다

translation.en: Yeah, the bad news is... we're gonna have to do summer school.
translation.ko: 나쁜 소식은 방학에 수업을 해야 한다는 거지

translation.en: Wait, those are both bad things!
I don't know, now I've got something to do this summer.
translation.ko: 글쎄, 드디어 여름에 할 일이 생겼네요

translation.en: Yeah, I got something to do this summer too, and it's not school.
translation.ko: 나도 여름에 할 일 있어 수업 말고!

translation.en: [in high-pitched voice] "Yay, Mr. Iglesias saved the day!
We love him and his hat!"
-[sighs] -What about your trip?
[in normal voice] Who wants to roll around in a cool Volkswagen bus,
listening to '90s jams and going to wrestling events?
translation.ko: 90년대 음악 듣고 레슬링 보러 가는 걸 좋아하겠어

translation.en: I'm gonna guess you?
Yeah.
-Yeah. -[clicks tongue]
Maybe I didn't think this through.
Whoo! Rookie of the Year!
-[cheers] -[Gabe] That's right.
As it turns out, it's a real award.
It's got your name engraved on it and everything.
-Aw! You guys are the best! -Mm-hmm.
Oh! There's only two Bs in Abby. Heh.
Bro, you had one job.
Ah, thank you. I see you got my text, Katie.
Your appletini -and your back-up appletini. -Mm-hmm! [chuckles]
translation.ko: 애플티니 한 잔에 애플티니 한 잔 더요

translation.en: How about you, Gabe? The usual, ginger ale on the rocks?
Yes, can I also have a lime in it? I ain't driving.
translation.ko: 네, 라임도 넣어줄래요? 운전 안 할 테니까

translation.en: Not to pry, Gabe, but is there a specific reason you don't drink?
translation.ko: 게이브, 참견하려는 건 아닌데 술 안 마시는 이유가 있나요?

translation.en: Well, if we're being honest, I kind of like remembering what I did
translation.ko: 솔직히 말하면 무슨 짓을 했는지 기억하고 싶어서 그래요

translation.en: and who I did it with.
Well, that's why I drink.
I like to forget what I did and who I did it with.
translation.ko: 누구랑 무슨 짓을 했는지 잊어버리고 싶거든

translation.en: Don't worry.
Eventually, you'll forget it all.
Only the grinding hip pain will remain.
Bone on bone.
Hey. Here's to the future, huh?
-Whoo! Bone on bone. -[Paula] Mm!
All right, Paula. -Who is the new honors teacher? -Oh!
I'm going to go with...
you, Tony!
Oh, suck a dictionary!
You know, somebody better teach this young gal how to swear,
translation.ko: 누가 애비한테 욕 좀 다시 가르쳐야겠어

translation.en: or she's gonna get laughed out of Long Beach.
I'm sorry, I'm just not a very good loser. [chuckles] -No practice. -[Ray] Mm-hmm.
translation.ko: 죄송해요, 지는 건 잘 못 해요 경험이 없어서요

translation.en: Abby, you can bring the kids up to your level.
translation.ko: 애비는 애들을 애비 수준으로 올릴 수 있죠

translation.en: I'm hoping the honors kids can bring Tony up to their level.
translation.ko: 우등반 애들이 토니를 자기들 수준으로 올려줄 거예요

translation.en: Well, thank you, Paula.
So, what kind of raise are we talking about here?
translation.ko: 그럼 이 일에 대한 제 보상은 뭘까요?

translation.en: I'm not gonna fire you.
-I do it for the kids. -Mm-hmm!
[laughs] To surviving another school year!
♪ The only one, my everything And to you, this song I sing ♪
